column4: Hi - Can someone please tell me how I can add an application to UBuntu's startup?
yes, there are a few ways
How would you recommend I add "beryl-manager" to startup
Ideally, you want to sort the problem you're having with system>preferences>sessions, as you want Beryl to start as soon as you log on, and not as soon as the computer boots..
That's what I figured, so why isn't the command beryl-manager saving?
Err - Not yet. I was just saying I am awesome. I'll figure it out in a second, I'm sure.
Again, I don't actually have 3...I was just saying :D
too late. My feelings are already hurt :-P
No help on the startup problem then?
well there's got to me a text file you can edit somewheres. I'll find it in a mo
You'd think so - Just a thought, perhaps I need to add the entire path of beryl-manager, not just "beryl-manager" - What would the path of that executable be in Linux, how can I find out?
